Criterion: Reward for documenting a focused, concise HPI that explicitly captures the patient's report of sertraline‚Äêrelated nausea (current severity, trend of improvement, impact on work/daily routine) and the patient's engagement with therapy, exercise, and meditation efforts
Rationale: HPI mentions sertraline-related nausea, notes that it is improving, and references engagement in therapy/exercise/meditation; however, it omits explicit current severity and concrete impact on work/daily routine.

Criterion: Reward for clearly listing the current medication sertraline 50 mg daily with its anxiety indication and explicitly noting the side-effect management strategy (continue at same dose for a few more weeks and option to adjust timing/dose or switch if nausea persists)
Rationale: Note references sertraline but omits dose (50 mg), frequency, anxiety indication, and any side-effect management plan.

Criterion: Reward for an evidence-based assessment and plan that: reaffirms anxiety diagnosis, states medication is within guideline dosing, encourages continued psychotherapy and lifestyle measures, and sets a specific follow-up interval to reassess side effects and symptom control
Rationale: No assessment/plan section: anxiety diagnosis, guideline dosing discussion, psychotherapy encouragement, and follow-up interval all absent.

Criterion: Reward for inclusion of patient-safety elements: screening or documentation of absence of suicidal ideation/worsening mood and clear instructions on when to seek urgent care for severe or persistent adverse effects
Rationale: No documentation of suicidal ideation screening or guidance on when to seek urgent care for adverse effects.

Criterion: Penalize for missing any of the following key medication details or actions: sertraline dose/frequency, description of nausea side effect, or a stated timeline for follow-up or medication adjustment
Rationale: Dose/frequency, nausea management strategy, and follow-up timeline are all missing, triggering this penalty criterion strongly.

Criterion: Penalize for inclusion of duplicated chart information or irrelevant extraneous content not discussed in this encounter, resulting in unnecessary note length
Rationale: Note is brief with no duplicated or irrelevant information, so minimal violation of this negative criterion.
